lines.text: How do you talk if you don't have a brain?
Well, some people without brains do an awful lot of talking don't they?

[stopping bicycle and getting off]
Gale?
Well, howdy, Miss Gulch.

[comes into the Gales' yard]
I want to see you and your wife right away about Dorothy!
Dorothy? Well, what has Dorothy done?
What she's done? I'm all but lame from the bite on my leg!
Oh! You mean she bit you?
No, her dog!
Oh, she bit her dog, eh?
[Uncle Henry tries to shut the gate, but it hits her on the backside]

[exasperated]
No!
Lions, and tigers, and bears! Oh, my!

[has just arrived in Oz, looking around and awed at the beauty and splendor]
Toto, I've a feeling we're not in Kansas any more.

[after a pause]
We must be over the rainbow!
[a bubble appears in the sky and gets closer and closer. It finally lands, then turns into Glinda the Good Witch wearing a spectacular white dress and crown, holding a wand]

[to Toto]
Now I... I know we're not in Kansas!
Just try and stay out of my way. Just try! I'll get you, my pretty, and your little dog, too!
A heart is not judged by how much you love; but by how much you are loved by others.

Almira Gulch, just because you own half the county doesn't mean that you have the power to run the rest of us. For twenty-three years, I've been dying to tell you what I thought of you! And now... well, being a Christian woman, I can't say it!
a diploma.

All right, I'll go in there for Dorothy. Wicked Witch or no Wicked Witch, guards or no guards, I'll tear them apart. I may not come out alive, but I'm going in there. There's only one thing I want you fellows to do.
What's that?
Talk me out of it!
As for you, my galvanized friend, you want a heart. You don't know how lucky you are not to have one. Hearts will never be practical until they can be made unbreakable.
But I still want one.
Pay no attention to that man behind the curtain.
[Dorothy watches the Wicked Witch melt]

You cursed brat! Look what you've done! I'm melting! melting! Oh, what a world! What a world! Who would have thought a good little girl like you could destroy my beautiful wickedness? Oooooh, look out! I'm going! Oooooh! Ooooooh!
I haven't got a brain... only straw.
How can you talk if you haven't got a brain?
I don't know... But some people without brains do an awful lot of talking... don't they?
Yes, I guess you're right.
You have no power here! Begone, before somebody drops a house on you, too!
lines.character: Glinda, the Good Witch of the North

lines.text: You, my friend, are a victim of disorganized thinking. You are under the unfortunate impression that just because you run away you have no courage; you're confusing courage with wisdom.
Your Majesty, if you were king, you wouldn't be afraid of anything?
Not nobody! Not nohow!
Not even a rhinoceros?
Imposerous!
How about a hippopotamus?
Why, I'd thrash him from top to bottomus!
Supposing you met an elephant?
I'd wrap him up in cellophane!
What if it were a brontosaurus?
I'd show him who was king of the forest!

[to the Scarecrow]
I think I'll miss you most of all.

[singing]
As Coroner I must aver, I thoroughly examined her, and she's not only merely dead, she's really most sincerely dead.
First they
[the Flying Monkeys]
took my legs off and they threw them over there! Then they took my chest out and they threw it over there!
Well, that's you all over!
[last lines]

Oh, but anyway, Toto, we're home. Home! And this is my room, and you're all here. And I'm not gonna leave here ever, ever again, because I love you all, and - oh, Auntie Em - there's no place like home!
Back where I come from there are men who do nothing all day but good deeds. They are called phila... er, phila... er, yes, er, Good Deed Doers.
Now which way do we go?
Pardon me, this way is a very nice way.
Who said that?
[Toto barks at scarecrow]
Don't be silly, Toto. Scarecrows don't talk.

[points other way]
It's pleasant down that way, too.
That's funny. Wasn't he pointing the other way?

[points both ways]
Of course, some people do go both ways.

Courage! What makes a king out of a slave? Courage! What makes the flag on the mast to wave? Courage! What makes the elephant charge his tusk in the misty mist, or the dusky dusk? What makes the muskrat guard his musk? Courage! What makes the sphinx the seventh wonder? Courage! What makes the dawn come up like thunder? Courage! What makes the Hottentot so hot? What puts the "ape" in apricot? What have they got that I ain't got?
Courage!
You can say that again! Huh?
My goodness, what a fuss you're making! Well naturally, when you go around picking on things weaker than you are. Why, you're nothing but a great big coward!

[crying]
You're right, I am a coward! I haven't any courage at all. I even scare myself.
[sobs]
Look at the circles under my eyes. I haven't slept in weeks!
Why don't you try counting sheep?
That doesn't do any good, I'm afraid of 'em.
[sobs loud]
Aw, that's too bad.
The sum of the square roots of any two sides of an isosceles triangle is equal to the square root of the remaining side. Oh joy! Rapture! I got a brain! How can I ever thank you enough?
You can't.

[singing]
Somewhere Over The Rainbow, Bluebirds fly. Birds fly Over The Rainbow. Why then, oh why can't I? If happy little bluebirds fly beyond the rainbow, why oh why cant I?
What have you learned, Dorothy?

Well, I - I think that it - it wasn't enough to just want to see Uncle Henry and Auntie Em - and it's that - if I ever go looking for my heart's desire again, I won't look any further than my own back yard. Because if it isn't there, I never really lost it to begin with! Is that right?
I *do* believe in spooks, I *do* believe in spooks. I do, I do, I do, I *do* believe in spooks, I *do* believe in spooks, I do, I do, I do, I *do*!
Ah! You'll believe in more than that before I'm finished with you.
Help us out today and find yourself a place where you won't get into any trouble!

A place where there isn't any trouble. Do you suppose there is such a place, Toto? There must be. It's not a place you can get to by a boat or a train. It's far, far away. Behind the moon, beyond the rain...
[begins to sing "Over the Rainbow"]
My! People come and go so quickly here!
Going so soon? I wouldn't hear of it. Why my little party's just beginning.
Only bad witches are ugly.
lines.character: Glinda, the Good Witch of the North

lines.text:
[after the Wicked Witch has melted]
She's... She's dead. You killed her.
I didn't mean to kill her. Really, I didn't. It's just that he was on fire.
Hail to Dorothy! The Wicked Witch is dead!

[all kneel before Dorothy]
*Hail*! Hail to Dorothy! The Wicked Witch is dead!
The broom! May we have it?

[hands Dorothy the broomstick]
Please. And take it with you.
Oh, thank you so much! Now we can go back to the Wizard, and tell him the Wicked Witch is dead!
The Wicked Witch is dead!
It really was no miracle. What happened was just this...

[singing]
The wind began to switch / The house, to pitch / And suddenly the hinges started to unhitch / Just then the Witch / To satisfy an itch / Went flying on her broomstick, thumbing for a hitch!
And, oh, what happened then was rich!

[singing]
The house began to pitch / The kitchen took a slich / It landed on the Wicked Witch in the middle of a ditch / Which was not a happy situation for the Wicked Witch!

Put 'em up, put 'em up! Which one of you first? I'll fight you both together if you want. I'll fight you with one paw tied behind my back. I'll fight you standing on one foot. I'll fight you with my eyes closed... ohh, pullin' an axe on me, eh? Sneaking up on me, eh? Why, I'll... Ruff!
Then this is a day of independence for all the Munchkins and their descendants!
If any!
Yes - let the joyous news be spread! The Wicked Old Witch at last is dead!
Did you say something?
[indiscernible sounds from the Tin Man, who is rusted]
He said oil can!
Oil can what?
Oil can.
Orders are nobody can see the Great Oz! Not nobody, not nohow!
lines.character: Guardian of the Emerald City Gates

lines.text: [Dorothy, the Scarecrow, and the Tin Man watch as the Wicked Witch of the West vanishes into a fireball]
I'm not afraid of her! I'll see you get safely to the Wizard now, whether I get a brain or not. Stuff a mattress with me. Ha!
I'll see you reach the Wizard, whether I get a heart or not. Beehive, bah! Let her try and make a beehive out of me!
[snaps]
Oh, you're the best friends anybody ever had. And it's funny, but I feel as if I'd known you all the time, but I couldn't have, could I?
I don't see how. You weren't around when I was stuffed and sewn together, were you?
And I was standing over there, rusting for the longest time.
Still, I wish I could remember, but I guess it doesn't matter anyway. We know each other now, don't we?
That's right.
We do.
To Oz?
To Oz.

[Reaches to pick an apple from the apple tree, the tree grabs the apple and slaps her hand]
Ouch!
What'd'ya think you're doing?
We've been walking a long ways and I was hungry and... did you say something?
She was hungry!

[Repeating after The Angry Apple Tree]
She was hungry!
Well, how would you like to have someone come along and pick something off of you?
Oh dear! I keep forgetting I'm not in Kansas!
Come along Dorothy. You don't want any of those apples!
[harrumphs]
a diploma. Therefore, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Universitartus Committiartum E Pluribus Unum, I hereby confer upon you the honorary degree of ThD.
ThD?
That's... Doctor of Thinkology.
Are you a good witch, or a bad witch?
lines.character: Glinda, the Good Witch of the North

lines.text: I'm not a witch at all. I'm Dorothy Gale from Kansas.
Oh. Well, is that the witch?
lines.character: Glinda, the Good Witch of the North

lines.text: Who, Toto? Toto's my dog!

[Toto is held hostage by the Witch and one of her monkeys]
What are you gonna do to my dog? Give him back to me!
Oh in good time my little petty. Oh in good time.
Oh please give me back my dog.
Certainly. Certainly. When you give me those slippers.
But the good Witch of the North told me not to.
Very well!
[to her flying monkey]
Throw that basket into the river and drown him!
No! No! Here! You can have your old slippers but give me back Toto!
That's a good little girl. I know you'd see reason!
[the Witch stoops to steal the shoes but fire burns Dorothy's toes and the Witch's hands. Both react in pain]
Oh! I'm sorry! I'm didn't do it. Can I still have my dog?

No! Fool that I am! I should have remembered! Those slippers will never come off as long as you're alive. But's that not what's worrying me. It's how to do it. These things must be done delicately or you hurt the spell.
Oh please, Professor, why can't we go with you and see all the Crowned Heads of Europe?
Do you know any? Oh, you mean the... thing. Yes.
Weren't you frightened?
Frightened? Child, you're talking to a man who's laughed in the face of death, sneered at doom, and chuckled at catastrophe... I was petrified.

[singing]
If I were king of the fore-e-e-est / Not queen, not duke, not prince / My regal robes of the fore-e-e-est / Would be satin, not cotton, not chintz / I'd command each thing, whether fish or fowl / With a r-r-ruff and a r-r-ruff, and a royal growl - R-R-Ruff! / As I click my heels / All the trees would kneel / And the mountains bow / And the bulls kowtow / And the sparrow would take wing / If I, if I were ki-i-i-i-ng! / The rabbits would show respect to me / The chipmunks genuflect to me / Though my tail would lash / I would show compash / For every underling / If I, if I were king / Just ki-i-i-i-ing!
Witch? Hmph, I'm not afraid of a witch. I'm not afraid of anything - except a lighted match.
[points to the straw in his arm]
I don't blame you for that.
Oh, Thank you so much! We've been gone such a long time and we feel so messy... What kind of a horse is that? I've never seen a horse like that before!
And never will again, I fancy. There's only one of him and he's it. He's the Horse of a Different Color, you've heard tell about.
lines.character: Guardian of the Emerald City Gates

lines.text: What would you do with a brain if you had one?
You go away or I - I'll bite you myself!
Dorothy!
How about a little fire, Scarecrow?
I've got a witch mad at me and you might get into trouble!

[in the Wizard's Throne Room with the three others, having returned from the Witch's castle]
Please, sir. We've done what you told us. We brought you the broomstick of the Wicked Witch of the West. We melted her!
Oh, you liquidated her, eh? Very resourceful!
If you don't hand over that dog, I'll bring a damage suit that'll take your whole farm! There's a law protecting folks against dogs that bite!
How would it be if she keeps him tied up? He's really gentle... with gentle people, that is.

[in a booming voice]
Step forward, Tin Man!

[terrified, steps forward]
Ohhhh!

[still in a booming voice]
You DARE to come to me for a heart, do you? You clinking, clanking, clattering collection of caligenous junk!
As for you, my galvanized friend, you want a heart. You don't know how lucky you are not to HAVE one! Hearts will NEVER be practical until they can be made unbreakable.
But that's not what's worrying me. It's how to do it. These things must be done delicately... or you hurt the spell.
Now you go feed those hogs before they worry themselves into anemia!

[to pigs]
Get in there, before I make a dime bank out of you.
Better get under cover, Sylvester. There's a storm blowin' up - a whopper, to speak in the vernacular of the peasantry. Poor little kid, I hope she gets home all right.
The last to go will see the first three go before her. And her little dog too.
I- I- I hope my strength holds out.

[hanging by Lion's tail]
I hope your tail holds out!
Where do you want to be oiled first?
I'll get you anyway, Pee-wee.
[Chases Toto; Dorothy hits him on the nose]
Shame on you!

[Sobbing]
Why did you do that for? I didn't bite him.
No, but you tried to. It's bad enough picking on a straw man, but picking on a little dog.
Well, you didn't have to go and hit me! Is my nose bleeding?
Of course not.
[Dorothy is brought to the Witch's castle]
What a nice little dog. And you, my dear, what an unexpected pleasure. It's so kind of you to want to visit me in my loneliness.
Who killed my sister? Who killed the Witch of the East? Was it you?
No, no. It was an accident. I didn't mean to kill anybody.
Well, my little pretty, I can cause accidents, too!
We can make a dimpled smile out of a frown.
Can you even dye my eyes to match my gown?
Uh-huh.
Jolly old town!
Goodbye, Tinman. Oh, don't cry! You'll rust so dreadfully. Here's your oil can.
Now I know I've got a heart, 'cause it's breaking...
Goodbye, Lion. I know it isn't right, but I'm going to miss the way you used to hollar for help before you found your courage.
I never would've found it if it hadn't been for you...

[to Scarecrow]
I think I'm going to miss you most of all.
Come on, get up and fight, you shivering junkyard!
[goes over to the Scarecrow]
And put your hands up, you lopsided bag of hay!
Now that's getting personal, Lion.
Yes. Get up and teach him a lesson.
Well, what's wrong with you teaching him?
Well, I hardly know him.
Come on, get up and fight, ya shivering junkyard! Put your hands up, ya lopsided bag o' hay!
Now that's getting personal, Lion!
Yes. Get up and teach him a lesson.
W-w-what's wrong with y-y-you teaching him?
W-w-well, I hardly know him.
You are talking to a man who has laughed in the face of death, sneered at doom and chuckled at catastrophe. I was petrified.

[as the Wizard's balloon goes off without her]
Come back! Come back! Don't go without me! Please come back!
I can't come back, I don't know how it works! Good-bye, folks!

[singing]
I'd be brave as a blizzard...

[singing]
I'd be gentle as a lizard...

[singing]
I'd be clever as a gizzard...

[singing]
If the Wizard is a wizard who will serve.

[singing]
Then I'm sure to get a brain...

[singing]
A heart...

[singing]
A home...

[singing]
The nerve!
"Courage". Ain't it the truth? Ain't it the truth?
[first lines]
She isn't coming yet, Toto. Did she hurt you? She tried to, didn't she? Come on. We'll go tell Uncle Henry and Auntie Em.
It's a twister! It's a twister!
And now, my beauties, something with poison in it, I think. With poison in it, but attractive to the eye, and soothing to the smell.
[cackles]
Poppies... Poppies. Poppies will put them to sleep. Sleeeeep. Now they'll sleeeeep!
I'm frightened, Auntie Em! I'm frightened!
[Auntie Em's image appears in the crystal ball]
Dorothy? Dorothy? Where are you? It's me, Auntie Em! We're trying to find you! Where are you?
I'm here in Oz, Auntie Em! I'm locked in the witch's castle, and I'm trying to get home to you, Auntie Em!
[Auntie Em's image fades out]
Oh, Auntie Em, don't go away! I'm frightened! Come back! Come back!
[the Wicked Witch's image appears in the crystal ball]
Auntie Em! Auntie Em! Come back! I'll give you Auntie Em, my pretty! Heh heh heh heh heh heh heh!
[to the audience]
Heh heh heh heh heh heh!

[booming voice]
And you, Scarecrow, have the affrontery to ask for a brain, you billowing bale of bovine fodder!
Y-Yes... Yes, Your Honor... I mean, Your Excellency... I-I mean, Your Wizardry.

[booming]
Enough!

[to Toto who is barking at him]
I'll get you anyway Pee Wee!
Pay no attention to the man behind the curtain!

[singing]
I could while away the hours/conferrin' with the flowers/consultin' with the rain/And my head I'd be scratchin'/ While my thoughts were busy hatchin'/If I only had a brain.
Ooh! What a smell of sulfur.
lines.character: Glinda, the Good Witch of the North

lines.text:
[noticing the snow that fallen on the poppy field]
Unusual weather we're having, ain't it?
Professor Marvel never guesses, he knows!
Come along, Dorothy. You don't want any of *those* apples.
[harrumphs]
Are you hinting my apples aren't what they ought to be?
Oh, no. It's just that she doesn't like little green worms!
Do you suppose we'll meet any wild animals?
Mm, we might.
Animals that eat... s-traw?
Some, but mostly lions, and tigers, and bears.
Lions?
And tigers?
And bears.
Who rang that bell?
lines.character: Guardian of the Emerald City Gates

lines.text:
[all four together]
We did!
Can't you read?
lines.character: Guardian of the Emerald City Gates

lines.text: Read what?
The notice!
lines.character: Guardian of the Emerald City Gates

lines.text: What notice?
It's on the door - as plain as the nose on my face! It... oh...
lines.character: Guardian of the Emerald City Gates

lines.text: [does a "tisk tisk tisk" expression, goes inside door for a moment]
[Guardian hangs the notice and goes back inside]
lines.character: Guardian of the Emerald City Gates

lines.text:
[Reading notice, all together]
Bell out of order, please knock.
[Dorothy knocks]
Well, that's more like it! Now, state your business!
lines.character: Guardian of the Emerald City Gates

lines.text:
[Dorothy and friends, all together]
We want to see the Wizard!

[gasps]
The Wizard? But nobody can see the Great Oz! Nobody's ever seen the Great Oz! Even I've never seen him!
lines.character: Guardian of the Emerald City Gates

lines.text: Well, then how do you know there is one?
Oh, you're wasting my time!
lines.character: Guardian of the Emerald City Gates

lines.text: [starts to close the window]
Oh, please! Please, sir! I've got to see the Wizard! The Good Witch of the North sent me!
Prove it!
lines.character: Guardian of the Emerald City Gates

lines.text: She's wearing the ruby slippers she gave her.
Oh, so she is! Well, bust my buttons! Why didn't you say that in the first place? That's a horse of a different color! Come on in!
lines.character: Guardian of the Emerald City Gates

lines.text: What about the heart that you promised Tin Man? Or the courage you promised Lion?
And Scarecrow's brain?
Do not arouse the wrath of the great and powerful Oz. I said come back tomorrow.

[speaking in a booming voice into microphone]
I am the great and powerful...
[then, realizing that it is useless to continue his masquerade, moves away from microphone, speaks in a normal voice]
... Wizard of Oz.
Listen, kid. Are you gonna try and let that old Gulch heifer try and buffalo ya'? She ain't nothing to be afraid of. Have a little courage, that's all.
I'm not afraid of her.
Well then, next time she squawks, walk right up to her and spit in her eye. That's what I'd do.
Ring around the rosie, a pocket full of spears! Thought you were pretty foxy, didn't you? Well! The last to go will see the first three go before her! And your mangy little dog, too!
[the Cowardly Lion has just received a Courage Medal from the Wizard of Oz]
Shucks, folks, I'm speechless. Ha Ha!
Here, here. Go away and let us alone.
Oh, scared, huh? Afraid, huh? Ah, how long can you stay fresh in that can? Ha ha ha ha.
Do you presume to criticize the Great Oz? You ungrateful creatures. Think yourselves lucky that I'm giving you an audience tomorrow, instead of 20 years from now.

[singing]
I'm afraid there's no denyin' / I'm just a dandy-lion / A fate I don't deserve / I'm sure I could show my prowess / Be a lion, not a mouse / If I only had the nerve.

[singing]
We get up at 12 and start to work at 1! Take an hour for lunch and then, at 2, we're done! Jolly good fun!
Now look here, Dorothy, you ain't using your head about Miss Gulch. You'd think you didn't have any brains at all.
I have so got brains.
Well, why don't you use them? When you come home, don't go by Miss Gulch's place. Then Toto won't get in her garden, and you won't get in no trouble. See?
Oh Hunk, you just won't listen, that's all.
Well, your head ain't made of straw, you know.
I saw you tinkering with that contraption, Hickory. Now you and Hunk get back to that wagon.
All right, Mrs. Gale. But someday, they're going to erect a statue to me in this town, and...
Don't start posing for it now.

[getting a panic attack walking into the Wizard's foyer]
Wait a minute, Fellows. I was just thinking. I really don't want to see the Wizard this much. I'd better wait for you outside.
What's the matter?
Oh, he's just a scared again.
Don't you know the Wizard's going to give you some courage?
I'd be too scared to ask him for it.
[sobs]
Well then, we'll ask him for you.
I'd sooner wait outside.
Why? Why?
Because I'm still scared.
[sobs]
Helping the little lady along are you, my fine gentlemen? Well stay away from her, or I'll stuff a mattress with you! And you, I'll make you into a beehive. Here Scarecrow, want to play ball?
I can barely hear my heart beating!
Come on, everybody to the storm cellar!
I've got a way to get us in there, and you're gonna lead us.
Help! Help!
It's no use screaming at a time like this. Nobody will hear you. Help! Help!
To confer, converse, and otherwise hob-nob with my brother wizards.

[singing repeatedly]
O-Ee-Yah! Eoh-Ah!
